bio.summary: Computer Engineering student with a strong interest in artificial intelligence and machine learning. This is my personal space where I share technical projects and learning experiences.
bio.objective: 💼 Looking for internships related to artificial intelligence or machine learning (starting June 2025).

projects.title: Selected Projects
projects.http_server: Low-level web server handling GET, POST, and OPTIONS requests using sockets in C.
projects.Game-of-the-ant: ASCII-art dungeon game where you play as an ant.
projects.Sistema-Domótico: Application that simulates a home automation system using message queues, with Discord as the user interface.
projects.coming_soon_desc: I'm currently working on new projects related to cybersecurity, networking, and backend. Stay tuned for updates!

contact.title: Contact
contact.description: Feel free to reach out through any of the following channels:

game.title: Ant Dungeon Game
game.desc: ASCII-art dungeon game coded in C, where you play as an ant navigating through levels.
game.learning_text: This was my first university project, where we learned to work with C and collaborate using GitHub.

http.title: 🖧 HTTP Server in C
http.desc: Lightweight HTTP server written in pure C, designed to handle basic HTTP requests through low-level socket programming.
http.f1: Supports GET, POST, and OPTIONS methods.
http.f2: No external libraries: only system calls and sockets.
http.f3: Manual parsing of HTTP headers and content.
http.f4: Robust connection handling (accept, fork, send, close).
http.learning_text: I deepened my understanding of the TCP/IP protocol, learned manual HTTP parsing, and practiced concurrency debugging and low-level header management. This project solidified my skills in both networking and systems programming.

domotica.title: Home Automation System
domotica.desc: Simulates a home automation system using message queues, with data persistence, rule control, multiple device types, and Discord as an interface. This project helped me understand message queues and work with non-traditional user interfaces.
domotica.f2: Various types of sensors (time, temperature, switch, etc.) for devices
domotica.f3: Rule definitions to manage device states
domotica.f4: Simulation of a distributed system with data persistence
domotica.learning_text: I learned to use the Paho (Mosquitto) library and how to design and organize a distributed system. I also implemented a graphical interface using Discord, a widely used app.
